name: Haunter

abilities.name: Transparency
abilities.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pok√©mon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

strengths: Transparency gives 50% chance to ignore all attack effects
counters: Multi-hit attacks get multiple coin flips
Gust of Wind to force out and attack repeatedly

competitiveHistory: Fossil Haunter was significantly better than the Base Set version due to its Transparency power. The 50% chance to completely negate attacks made it frustrating to deal with and bought time to set up Gengar. Combined with its free retreat, Haunter could stall effectively. It was a key component of Gengar-based spread damage decks and gave the evolution line much-needed survivability.

rulings.ruling: Transparency triggers for each attack, including multi-target attacks. Flip once per attack that targets Haunter.
If Transparency prevents the attack, all effects are prevented including status conditions, damage, and any other effects.
Transparency does not protect against effects that don't do anything 'to' Haunter, such as switching or effects on the attacking player.
Nightmare always causes Sleep regardless of Transparency or other factors.
